description: From Middle French intolerable, from Latin intolerābilis. Synchronically, in- +‎ tolerable.

adjectives.description: intolerable (comparative more intolerable, superlative most intolerable)

entries.meaning: Not tolerable; not capable of being borne or endured.

examples: It is an intolerable sound that sets spoons tinkling in saucers and windowpanes vibrating.

entries.meaning: (nuclear power) Extremely worn and degraded, to the point of being unsafe.
